subject: Re: Note to ALL: Convert your WAV files to MP3
author: Misty
full_text:
Thanks Stefan. Yes for some things we obviously need/want to post as 
larger formats thats why I suggested people try esnips or another 
file sharing service. It's just gotten to the point of no choice but 
do something different than how we previously have done it before. 
Every little bit helps =)

Misty

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Stefan Bion" <yahoogroups@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Misty,
> 
> if possible, I post all my audio files in the MP3 format. However, 
some files that include cue lists must be stored in the WAV format 
for technical reasons. If that's a problem, I can upload my files to 
my own webspace rather than to the group's Files section, and only 
post the links.
> 
> Stefan :)
> 
> -- 
> 
> > Hello all. It's that time again for me to remind you that the 
group 
> > is low on space (96% used) and actions will be taken. For now 
rather 
> > than delete everyones files I am asking that you convert your wav 
> > format into mp3 or smaller format before you post them to the 
files 
> > area.
> > 
> > One member using 10+ megs out of our groups 100 total megs just 
isnt 
> > going to fly anymore. So starting in May all files that are not 
> > within size limits and arent in smallest formats will have to 
start 
> > to get deleted.
> > 
> > For those who cant convert your files I have programs that are 
free 
> > to help you do that. For those that dont want to convert your 
files, 
> > you can use esnips to post your larger files and share them with 
the 
> > group as links in posts. For those that ignore my posts and do 
what 
> > you want to anyway, your stuff will be deleted and your option to 
> > upload and share here in group will be disabled.
> > 
> > As I said we have 100 (one hundred) megs total in file section 
for 
> > sharing, please do not abuse your share of that space. As you can 
see 
> > there are others who like to share too. Eventually we may just 
clean 
> > it out of everyones files but for now lets try and stick to 
> > compacting the things we upload and make use of places like 
esnips 
> > for sharing.
> > 
> > Misty
>
